intro: Astephanus sprucei, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance. Astephanus sprucei is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
